summary: Amy Coney Barrett will face a second day of grilling from lawmakers on the Senate Judiciary Committee after fending off questions on Obamacare and abortion in a marathon session Tuesday.
headline: Amy Coney Barrett to face more questions from senators on Wednesday
Fintech wins when bank stocks go down, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Whenever the bank stocks go down, we immediately get a massive amount of option-call buying in PayPal and Square," the "Mad Money" host said.
Crossmark Global Investments’ Victoria Fernandez believes another round of stimulus is vital to the economic recovery.
headline: Time is running out for a virus aid deal that'll keep consumers spending, Crossmark's Victoria Fernandez warns

summary: "If you really want cruise exposure, I say be patient, because days like today make me think you'll get better buying opportunities," CNBC's Jim Cramer said Tuesday.
headline: Cramer to investors: It's still too early to be speculating in the cruise line stocks

summary: As of Tuesday evening, more than 4,000 employees have signed onto the petition.
headline: Thousands of Amazon employees have petitioned for paid time off to vote

summary: The "Mad Money" host broke down chart analysis from Tom DeMark, who forecasts the market could tank before bottoming ahead of the November contest.
headline: Jim Cramer recommends investors be ready to do some buying before Election Day

summary: U.S. stock index futures were little changed in overnight trading, as the major averages looked to make back some of Tuesday's losses.
headline: U.S. stock futures little changed after major averages snap four-day winning streak
Supreme Court sides with Trump administration bid to end 2020 census count
Apple's full-size iPhone 12 costs at least $100 more than last year's iPhone 11
summary: Apple announced big changes to the iPhone lineup's segmentation and pricing at Tuesday's event.
The U.S. natural gas boom from 2015 to 2017 has come screeching to a halt that could become more permanent as gas plant construction is expected to be displaced by record solar and wind builds.
headline: Is the gas combined cycle plant an endangered species?

summary: San Francisco-based Dropbox announced Tuesday that will stop asking employees to come into its offices and instead make remote work the standard practice.
headline: Dropbox is the latest San Francisco tech company to make remote work permanent

summary: Disney has promoted Kareem Daniel, the former president of consumer products, games and publishing. He will now oversee the new media and entertainment distribution group.
headline: Meet Kareem Daniel, the head of Disney's new distribution unit
How to trade health care stocks into the 2020 U.S. presidential election
summary: With less than a month until the election, and Democratic challenger Joe Biden opening up a wide lead, two market analysts lay out how to trade the politically sensitive health-care sector.

headline: Personal finance advice relies on shame; what if we tried empathy?
summary: Emma Pattee and Stefanie O’Connell Rodriguez, the cofounders of Statement, argue the personal finance industry needs a reset. It's time to move away from shaming clients and show them empathy instead.

headline: Facebook says it will finally ban anti-vaccination ads
summary: Facebook said Tuesday it is launching a new global policy that bans ads that discourage people from getting vaccines. The company previously did have a policy against vaccine hoaxes that were publicly identified by global health organizations.
"The problems we've had here — the number of cases, the number of deaths, the number of hospitalizations — was not inevitable,” Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel told CNBC on Tuesday.
headline: Data shows failed U.S. coronavirus safety measures cost lives, says ex-Obama health advisor

summary: Satellite services and debris removal specialist Astroscale on Tuesday announced it closed a $51 million round of funding.
headline: Astroscale, which fixes and extends the life of satellites in orbit, raises $51 million

summary: President Trump and Democrats disagree over the amount of stimulus needed in the next round of coronavirus aid for the country. Here are the major topics of debate.
headline: What's the holdup? Why you haven't gotten a second $1,200 stimulus check
Treasury yields fall as traders weigh U.S. coronavirus stimulus prospects
summary: Treasury yields slipped on Tuesday as traders digest the latest news surrounding a potential U.S. fiscal stimulus package along with muted inflation growth.

headline: "You're so stressed you can't sleep at night": Parents and child-care providers are still struggling as the pandemic drags on
summary: Before the coronavirus pandemic hit in March, there were nearly 12 million children under the age of 5 enrolled in some type of child care nationwide. But the pandemic caused widespread closures and enrollment still has not fully rebounded.
